page.title: 11Dairying at Woodend Farm
page.content: Mr. Johnson farms a total of three farms, Woodend, Tanhouse, Seedhouse, 320 hectares in all. Woodend is a dairy farm and has 240 Friesian cows and 4 bulls - 3 Friesian and one Hereford. In summer the cows live in fields but in winter they are kept in cubicles in an enclosed cowshed. They are fed silage, hay and treated barley when grass is not available. The cows are milked twice a day, 16 at a time, about 100 an hour. The milk is sent through cooling equipment to a 6025 l storage tank and kept at 5 C. Then it is pasteurised and bottled on the farm. The milk is only exposed to air for about 10 seconds when the top is put on it. The equipment is automatically cleaned after every usage. Milk is sold as pasteurised, sterilised and skimmed.
